intro: Sinocarum muliense, commonly known as the Muli sandwort, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, fleshy leaves and produces clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
